Patient Particulars: Name: Barbara; Sex: Female; Occupation: Currently unemployed since past 1 year
Referral Information: Referrer name: Dr Brown; Reason for referral: No response to medications and the referring doctor feels that the illness is psychiatric
Presenting Complaints (Symptoms):
1. Bloating:4yrs
2. Alternating diarrhoea and constipation: 4yrs
3. Abdominal cramps: On and off since 4 yrs
History:
Patient was apparently maintaining well 4 yrs back when she went for a trip to Egypt. She reports that she suffered from fever and diarrhea back there and has been facing the above mentioned symptoms since then. According to the patient the symptoms get exaggerated during times of stress and get somewhat relieved when her mood is better. The symptoms have remained the same in the past 4 yrs but have affected the patient's quality of life. She gets troubling thoughts that these might be symptoms of a grave illness that nobody is able to detect and diagnose and that she might die of cancer as her mother in law did an year ago. She went from full time to working part time and stopped working altogether 1 year ago. Despite taking multiple medications her symptoms are not getting relieved for which she was sent by her doctor to the therapist.
Treatment history: Multiple meds since past 4 yrs including Imodium
Past history: Underwent gastroscopy and barium enema which came out to be normal
Issues discussed in Current Session:
History of the presenting complaints was discussed alongwith how they have affected the patient's life.
Patient was psychoeducated about mind playing a role in the altered perception of symptoms
Action Plan:
1.Pt was told to make a list of the medicines she has been taking and bring those with her in the next session
2.To try and go out with her female friends every week as she used to do earlier
Next session details: Pt asked to book a double slot next week
